statements: UPDATE ParentalSurvey SET parent_name = 'John Doe', parent_email = 'john.doe@example.com' WHERE survey_id = 1;
UPDATE ParentalSurvey SET survey_response = 'Very satisfied', response_date = '2022-02-08' WHERE parent_name = 'Jane Smith';
UPDATE ParentalSurvey SET survey_response='Excellent', response_date='2021-10-15' WHERE parent_name='John Smith' AND survey_id=1;
UPDATE ParentalSurvey SET survey_response='Good', parent_email='jane.doe@example.com' WHERE parent_name='Jane Doe' AND response_date='2022-01-20';
UPDATE ParentalSurveyResponses SET response = 'Very satisfied' WHERE parent_id = 101;
UPDATE ParentalInvolvement SET feedback = 'Great job!' WHERE school_id = 201 AND parent_id = 101 AND involvement_level = 3;
UPDATE ParentalSurveyResponses SET response = 'Very satisfied', timestamp = '2022-05-23 09:30:00' WHERE survey_id = 1;
UPDATE ParentalInvolvement SET feedback = 'Great communication with teachers', involvement_level = 3, timestamp = '2022-05-24 12:45:00' WHERE parent_id = 2;
UPDATE parent_survey_responses SET response = 'Agree' WHERE parent_id = 123 AND question = 'How satisfied are you with the school?'
UPDATE school_analysis SET analysis_result = 'Good' WHERE school_id = 456 AND analysis_category = 'Overall performance'
UPDATE parent_survey_responses SET response = 'Agree' WHERE parent_id = 100 AND question = 'Overall satisfaction';
UPDATE parent_information SET email = 'newemail@example.com', parent_name = 'John Doe' WHERE parent_id = 200;

SET response = 'Agree'
WHERE survey_id = 101

UPDATE ParentalSupport
SET support_date = '2022-06-15'
WHERE support_id = 201

UPDATE Students SET grade_level = 11, student_name = 'Alice' WHERE parent_id = 101;
